articles.description: WINCHESTER — At first glance, the scenes presented in Abbey Hepner’s photography seem fairly mundane: A lone sign and barbed wire fence in the middle of a grassy field, or pale corporate buildings sitting on the horizon across a plain.
articles.title: UCC hosts 'Transuranic,' a radioactive photography exhibit

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: Randi Janeksela and her son Markus Janeksela played a few matches of chess to warm up at the Roseburg Public Library’s Chess Club on Saturday.
articles.title: Roseburg Public Library hosts Chess Club

articles.author: Kyle Bailey For The News-Review
articles.description: ROSEBURG — Roseburg Elks Lodge #326 will have its 129th birthday bash this weekend.
articles.title: Roseburg Elks Lodge to celebrate 129 birthday with a bash

articles.author: Kyle Bailey For The News-Review
articles.description: ELKTON — The Oregon State University Extension Service in Douglas County, in partnership with Umpqua Soil & Water Conservation District, are offering a fruit tree pruning workshop Saturday, Jan. 17.
articles.title: Local partnership to offer pruning workshop

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: The Moon Mountain String Band brought a variety of tones to The Rosebud Theatre on Saturday night, flooding the stage with a banjo, mandolin, fiddle, an acoustic bass, twin guitars and multiple voices.
articles.title: Moon Mountain String Band opens 2026 at The Rosebud Theater

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: The Roseburg Elks Lodge held the local annual Hoop Shoot on Dec 3, 2025, with children ages 8-13 joining in at the Fremont Middle School gym in Roseburg.
articles.title: Local hoopers qualify for Elks' District Hoop Shoot

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: ODFW is accepting applications for paid Wildlife Student Internships for summer and fall 2026. College students can gain hands-on field experience in wildlife management, habitat restoration, and research across Oregon. Applications close Jan. 20, 2026.
articles.title: ODFW Opens Paid Wildlife Student Internships for Summer & Fall 2026

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Diamond Lake Resort received 12 inches of snow in the past 24 hours, bringing the base to 23 inches at 5,200 feet. The tubing hill opens for night tubing at 6 p.m. tomorrow (01/09), with snowmobile trails also being groomed as winter recreation ramps up.
articles.title: Diamond Lake Resort Opens Tubing Hill After 12 Inches of Fresh Snow

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg police reported multiple enforcement contacts tied to prohibited camping and littering near waterways, plus several warrant arrests. Incidents also included a domestic menacing case follow-up, a driving-while-suspended arrest, and a non-injury crash.
articles.title: Police Log: January 7, 2026

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop
articles.title: January 8, 2026

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A Roseburg man was arrested after police responded to a reported burglary at a vacant SE Pine Street home. Officers found extensive interior damage exceeding $1,000. The suspect was later located nearby and faces burglary and criminal mischief charges.
articles.title: Roseburg Man Arrested Following Burglary at Vacant SE Pine Street Home

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A stolen vehicle stop in Roseburg on Jan. 6 led to the arrest of a Portland man after police reportedly found methamphetamine, multiple fictitious IDs, and equipment used to make false identification. Officers also discovered an outstanding probation violation warrant.
articles.title: Portland Man Arrested in Roseburg After Stolen Vehicle Stop

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg Police handled multiple incidents Jan. 6, including arrests on outstanding warrants, a stolen vehicle recovery involving meth and false ID charges, burglary and trespass cases, and a harassment citation. Several individuals were cited and lodged at corrections.
articles.title: Police Log: January 6

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Starting Jan. 6, 2026, NFSR 3401, the road to Umpqua Hot Springs, will close due to a winter storm. Vehicles must park at the gate. Visitors must hike, snowshoe, or ski the final 2.5 miles.
articles.title: Road to Umpqua Hot Springs Closed Due to Winter Storm

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop
articles.title: January 7, 2026

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Wildlife Safari kicks off 2026 with Douglas County Appreciation Days Jan. 18–19, offering free drive-thru admission for county residents. January also includes youth camps, seasonal animal viewing, and new DoorDash menu delivery.
articles.title: January Happenings at Wildlife Safari

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: FSC CrossFit has announced it will close after nearly 12 years in Roseburg, with its final class scheduled for Dec. 19, 2025. Owners Gil and Janelle Brown thanked members and said equipment will be sold beginning Jan. 5.
articles.title: FSC CrossFit Announces Closure After More Than a Decade in Roseburg

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg Police logged multiple arrests and citations Jan. 5, including warrants, theft, restraining order violations, and several traffic crashes. Incidents ranged from drug possession and stolen property to injury crashes at major intersections.
articles.title: Police Log: January 5

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A Winter Storm Warning remains in effect for the Southern Oregon Cascades and Siskiyou Mountains through Thursday morning. Heavy snow, strong winds, and hazardous travel are expected, with up to 20 inches possible at higher elevations.
articles.title: Winter Storm Warning Remains in Effect for Southern Oregon Cascades and Siskiyou Mountains

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop
articles.title: January 6, 2026

articles.author: Holden LeCroy
articles.description: Expect some fairly low snow levels Wednesday and Thursday mornings down to as low as 2,500-feet, but the heaviest in the Cascades for up to 24" of new snow by Thursday morning.
articles.title: Showers for the Valley, Heavy Mountain Snow
